hadiths.text: Ibn `Umar narrated that:the Prophet said: "Salat will not be accepted without purification, nor Charity from Ghulul." Hannad said in his narration, "except with purification" [Abu `Eisa said: This Hadith is the most correct thing on this topic, and the best. There are also narrations on this topic from Abu Al-Malih, from his father; and Abu Hurairah and Anas. And Abu Al-Malih bin Usamah's name is `Amir, and they also say it was Zaid bin Usamah bin `Umair Al-Hudhali]

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ لاَ تُقْبَلُ صَلاَةٌ بِغَيْرِ طُهُورٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That Salat Is Not Accepted Without Purification

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When a Muslim, or believer, performs Wudu', washing his face, every evil that he looked at with his eyes leaves with the water - or with the last drop of water, or an expression similar to that - and when he washes his hands, every evil he did with his hands leaves with the water - or with the last drop of water - until he becomes free of sin

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الطُّهُورِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Purification

hadiths.text: Ali narrated that :the Prophet, said: "The key to Salat is the purification, its Tahrlm is the Takblr, and its Tahlil is the Taslim

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ مِفْتَاحَ الصَّلاَةِ الطُّهُورُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has been Related That The Key To Salat Is Purification

hadiths.text: Jabir bin 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them, narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The key to Paradise is Salat, and the key to Salat is Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ مِفْتَاحَ الصَّلاَةِ الطُّهُورُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has been Related That The Key To Salat Is Purification

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik said:"When the Prophet entered the toilet he would say: 'O Allah Indeed I seek refuge in You.'" Shu'bah (one of the narrators) said: "Another time he said: 'I seek refuge in You from AI-Khubthi and al-Khablth.' Or: 'Al-Khubthi and Al-Khaba'ith

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا دَخَلَ الْخَلاَءَ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said When entering The Toilet

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik said:"When the Prophet would enter the toilet 'He said: "O Allah! Indeed I seek refuge in You from Al-Khubith and Al- Khaba'ith

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا دَخَلَ الْخَلاَءَ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said When entering The Toilet

hadiths.text: Aishah, [may Allah be pleased with her] said:"When the Prophet would exit the toilet he would say: 'Ghufranak

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا خَرَجَ مِنَ الْخَلاَءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said When Exiting The Toilet

hadiths.text: Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you arrives to defecate, then let none of you face the Qiblah while defecating, nor while urinating. And do not have your back towards it, but have it east of you or west of you

chapter.ara-name: باب فِي النَّهْىِ عَنِ اسْتِقْبَالِ الْقِبْلَةِ، بِغَائِطٍ أَوْ بَوْلٍ
chapter.eng-name: Regarding The Prohibition Of Facing The Qiblah When Defecating And Urinating.

hadiths.text: Jabir bin Abdullah said:"The Prophet prohibited us from facing the Qiblah while urinating. Then i saw him facing it a year before he died

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مِنَ الرُّخْصَةِ فِي ذَلِكَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Permission for That

hadiths.text: Abu Qatadah narrated that :he saw the Prophet urinating while facing the Qiblah. Qutaibah narrated that to us, he said: "Ibn Lahi'ah informed us." Jabir's Hadlth about the Prophet is more correct than the Hadith of Ibn Lahi'ah. Ibn Lahi'ah is weak according to the scholars of Hadith. He was graded weak by Yahya bin Sa'eed Al-Qattan, and others, [due to his memorization]

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مِنَ الرُّخْصَةِ فِي ذَلِكَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Permission for That

hadiths.text: Ibn 'Umar said:"One day I climbed on Hafsah's house, and I saw the Prophet relieving himself while facing Ash-Sham, with his back toward the Ka'bah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مِنَ الرُّخْصَةِ فِي ذَلِكَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Permission for That

hadiths.text: Aishah said:"Whoever narrated to you that the Prophet would urinate while standing; then do not believe him. He would not urinate except while squatting." [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Umar, Buraidah, [and Abdur-Rahman bin Hasanah]

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْبَوْلِ، قَائِمًا
chapter.eng-name: (What Has Been Related About) The Prohibition Of Urinating While Standing

hadiths.text: Hudhaifah narrated:"Allah's Messenger came to a waste area used by people, so he urinated on it while standing. I brought him the (water for) Wudu. Then I left to be away from him, but he called me until I was behind him. So he performed Wudu and wiped (Masaba) over his Khuff

chapter.ara-name: باب الرُّخْصَةِ فِي ذَلِكَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Permission For That

hadiths.text: Anas, may Allah Most High be pleased with him, said:"When the Prophet wanted to relieve himself, he would not raise his garment until he was close to the ground

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِسْتِتَارِ عِنْدَ الْحَاجَةِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Being Screened While Relieving Oneself

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Abu Qatadah narrated from his father:"The Prophet prohibited that a man should touch his penis with his right hand

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهَةِ الاِسْتِنْجَاءِ بِالْيَمِينِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Use The Right Hand For Istinja.

hadiths.text: Abdur-Rahman bin Yazld said, :"They said to Salman, 'Your Prophet taught you about everything, even defecating?' So Salman said, 'Yes. He prohibited us from facing the Qiblah when defecating and urinating, performing Istinja with the right hand, using less than three stones for Istinja, and using dung or bones for Istinja

chapter.ara-name: باب الاِسْتِنْجَاءِ بِالْحِجَارَةِ
chapter.eng-name: Using Stones For Al-Istinja

hadiths.text: Abdullah said:"Allah's Messenger went out to relieve himself. So he said: 'Bring me tree stones.'" He said, "So I came with two stones and a piece of dung. So he took the two stones, and left the dung. He said: 'It is Riks (a degenerative or filthy thing)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِسْتِنْجَاءِ بِالْحَجَرَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Istinja With Two Stones

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Do not perform Istinja, with dung, nor with bones. For indeed it is provisions for your brothers among the Jinn

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ مَا يُسْتَنْجَى بِهِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related Regarding] What Is Disliked For One to use for Istinja

hadiths.text: Aishah said:"Encourage your Husbands to clean themselves with water, for I am too shy of them, and Allah's Messenger would do that

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِسْتِنْجَاءِ بِالْمَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Reported About] Istinja With Water

hadiths.text: Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah said:I was with the Prophet on a journey. The Prophet had to relieve himself, so he went far away

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ إِذَا أَرَادَ الْحَاجَةَ أَبْعَدَ فِي الْمَذْهَبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That When The Prophet (ﷺ) Wanted To Relieve Himself, He Would Go Far Away

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mughaffal narrated that :the Prophet prohibited that a man should urinate in his bathing area. And he said: "It will only cause misgivings." [He said:] There are narrations on This topic from "a man from among the Companions of the Prophet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الْبَوْلِ فِي الْمُغْتَسَلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That It Is Disliked To Urinate In The Washing Area

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "If it were not that it would be difficult on my nation, then I would have ordered them to use the Siwak for each prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي السِّوَاكِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Siwak

hadiths.text: Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhani said :'I heard Allah's Messenger saying: 'If it were not that it would be difficult on my nation then, I would have ordered them to use the Siwak for each prayer and to delay the Isha prayer until the third of the night.'"He [Abu Salamah, one of the narrators] said: Zaid bin Khalid wouId attend the prayer in the Masjid and his Siwak would be on his ear in the location of the pen on the ear of a writer. He would not get up to pray without cleaning his teeth, then returning it to its location

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي السِّوَاكِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Siwak

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah reported that the :Prophet said: "When on of you awakens in the night, then let him not put his hand into the vessel until he has poured water on two times, or three times, for indeed he does not know where his hand has spent the night

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ إِذَا اسْتَيْقَظَ أَحَدُكُمْ مِنْ مَنَامِهِ فَلاَ يَغْمِسْ يَدَهُ فِي الإِنَاءِ حَتَّى يَغْسِلَهَا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That When One Of You Awakens From His Sleep, Then Let Him Not Put His Hand Into Vessel Until He Washes it.

hadiths.text: Rabah bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Sufyan bin Huwaitib narrated from his grandmother, from her father; she said (that he said):"I heard Allah's Messenger saying: there is no Wudu for one who does not mention Allah's Name over it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّسْمِيَةِ عِنْدَ الْوُضُوءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Tasmiyah When Performing Wudu

hadiths.text: Rabah Bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abu Sufyan bin Huwaitib narrated :the same from his grandmother the daughter of Sa'eed bin Zaid, from her father, from the Prophet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّسْمِيَةِ عِنْدَ الْوُضُوءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Tasmiyah When Performing Wudu

hadiths.text: Salamah bin Qais narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When you perform Wudu then sniff water in the nose and blow it out, and when you use small stones (to remove filth) then make it odd (numbered)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَضْمَضَةِ وَالاِسْتِنْشَاقِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Al-Madmadah And AI-Istinshaq

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Zaid said:"1 saw the Prophet rinse his mouth and sniff water in his nose using one hand, he did that thrice

chapter.ara-name: باب الْمَضْمَضَةِ وَالاِسْتِنْشَاقِ مِنْ كَفٍّ وَاحِدٍ
chapter.eng-name: Al-Madmadah And Istinshaq From One Handful

hadiths.text: Hassan bin Bilal said:"1 saw Ammar bin Yasir performing Wudu, so he went through his beard (with his hand). It was said to him" - or he said - "1 said: 'You go through your beard?' He said: 'And what is there to prevent me? Indeed I saw Allah's Messenger going through his beard

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَخْلِيلِ اللِّحْيَةِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been narrated] About Going through The Beard

hadiths.text: (In another narration) Ammar narrated :the same from the Prophet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَخْلِيلِ اللِّحْيَةِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been narrated] About Going through The Beard

hadiths.text: Uthman bin Affan narrated that :the Prophet would go through his beard

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَخْلِيلِ اللِّحْيَةِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been narrated] About Going through The Beard

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Zaid narrated that:"Allah's Messenger wiped over his head with his hands, going over the front with them and the rear. He began with the front of his head until they went to the nape of his neck. Then he brought them back again to the place where he began. Then he washed his feet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مَسْحِ الرَّأْسِ أَنَّهُ يَبْدَأُ بِمُقَدَّمِ الرَّأْسِ إِلَى مُؤَخَّرِهِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wiping The Head, That It Is To Begin With The Front Of The Head To Its Rear.

hadiths.text: Ar-Rubay' bint Mu'awwidh bin Afra' narrated:"The Prophet wiped his head two times: He began with the rear of his head, then with the front of his head and with both of his ears, outside and Inside of them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّهُ يُبْدَأُ بِمُؤَخَّرِ الرَّأْسِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That It Is To Be Begun At The Rear Of The Head

hadiths.text: Ar-Rubayy bint Mu'awidh bin Afra narrated that :she saw the Prophet performing Wudu. She said: "He wiped his head, and what is in the front of it and what is in its rear, and his temples and his ears one time

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ مَسْحَ الرَّأْسِ مَرَّةٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wiping The Head Once

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Zaid narrated that :he saw the Prophet performing Wudu, and that he wiped his head with water that was not left over from his hands

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّهُ يَأْخُذُ لِرَأْسِهِ مَاءً جَدِيدًا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About One Taking New Water For (Wiping) His Head

hadiths.text: Ibn 'Abbas narrated:"The Prophet wiped his head and his ears: the outside and the inside of them." ($ahih)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مَسْحِ الأُذُنَيْنِ ظَاهِرِهِمَا وَبَاطِنِهِمَا
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] Wiping The Outside And The Inside Of The Ears

hadiths.text: Abu Umamah narrated:"The Prophet performed Wudu; so he washed his face three times, and his hands three times, and wiped his head, and he said: "The ears are part of the head

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الأُذُنَيْنِ مِنَ الرَّأْسِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That The Ears Are Part Of The Head

hadiths.text: Asim bin Laqit bin Sabirah narrated from his father that :the Prophet Muhammad said: "When performing Wudu go between the fingers

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَخْلِيلِ الأَصَابِعِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Going Between The Fingers

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When performing Wudu go between the fingers of your hands and (toes of) your feet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَخْلِيلِ الأَصَابِعِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Going Between The Fingers

hadiths.text: Al-Mustawrid bin Shaddad Al-Fihri said :"I saw the Prophet when he was performing Wudu doing that to the toes on his feet with his pinky

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَخْلِيلِ الأَصَابِعِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Going Between The Fingers

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Protect the heels from the Fire

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ " وَيْلٌ لِلأَعْقَابِ مِنَ النَّارِ "
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About: "Protect The Heels From The Fire."

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"The Prophet performed Wudu one time (for each limb)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مَرَّةً مَرَّةً
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wudu' One Time (For Each Limb)

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"The Prophet performed Wudu two time (for each limb)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مَرَّتَيْنِ مَرَّتَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Reported About Wudu Two Times (For Each Limb)

hadiths.text: Ali narrated that:"The Prophet performed Wudu three times (for each limb)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ ثَلاَثًا ثَلاَثًا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wudu Three times (For Each Limb)

hadiths.text: Thabit bin Abi Safiyyah said, :"I asked Abu Ja'far: 'Did Jabir narrate to you that: "The Prophet performed Wudu one time each, and two times, and three times?" He said: "Yes

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مَرَّةً وَمَرَّتَيْنِ وَثَلاَثًا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wudu One Time, Two Times And Three Times

hadiths.text: Thabit bin Abi Safiyyah said, :"1 asked Abu Ja'far: 'Did Jabir narrate to you that: "The Prophet performed Wudu one time each?" He said: "Yes

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مَرَّةً وَمَرَّتَيْنِ وَثَلاَثًا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wudu One Time, Two Times And Three Times

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Zaid narrated that:"The Prophet performed Wudu. So he washed his face three times, and washed his hands two times each, and wiped his head, and washed his feet [two times]

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ يَتَوَضَّأُ بَعْضَ وُضُوئِهِ مَرَّتَيْنِ وَبَعْضَهُ ثَلاَثًا
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About One Who performs Some Of Wudu, Two Times Each, And Some Of It Three

hadiths.text: Abu Hayyah narrated:"I saw Ali performing Wudu. He washed his hands until he cleaned them, then he rinsed out his mouth three times, sniffed water into his nose and blew it out three times, washed his face three times, and his forearms three times. He wiped his head once, then he washed his feet up to the ankles. Then he stood up, taking what was left over from his purification (water) and drank it while he was standing. Then he said, 'I wanted to show you how Allah's Messenger purified himself

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وُضُوءِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَيْفَ كَانَ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Wudu Of he Prophet: How Was It Performed?

hadiths.text: Abd Khair related a narration similar to that of Abu Hayyah, :from Ali (no. 48). Except that Abd Khair's version includes the following additions: "When he was finished from his purification, he would take what was left over from his purification with his hand to drink it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وُضُوءِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَيْفَ كَانَ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Wudu Of he Prophet: How Was It Performed?

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Jibril came to me and he said: 'O Muhammad! When you perform wudu then perform Nadh

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي النَّضْحِ بَعْدَ الْوُضُوءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About An-Nadh After Wudu

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Shall I tell you that for which Allah will wipe out your sins, and raise your ranks?" They said, "Of course Allah's Messenger!" He said: "Performing Wudu well in difficulty, and taking many steps to the Masajid, and waiting for Salat after Salat, That is the Ribat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِسْبَاغِ الْوُضُوءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu Perfectly And Completely (Isbagh AI-Wudu)

hadiths.text: Qutaibah said in his narration:"For that is the Ribat, that is the Ribat, that is the Ribat" three times

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِسْبَاغِ الْوُضُوءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu Perfectly And Completely (Isbagh AI-Wudu)

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger had a cloth that he would use to dry off with after Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّمَنْدُلِ بَعْدَ الْوُضُوءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Using a Towel after Wudu

hadiths.text: Muadh bin Jabal narrated:"I saw the Prophet when he performed Wudu, he wiped his face with the edge of his garment." Abu Eisa said: This Hadith is gharib, and its chain is weak. Rishdin bin Sa'd and Abdur- Rahman bin Ziyad bin An'um Al Ifriqi [narrators in the chain of this Hadith] are weak in Hadith. Some people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet and those after them, permitted using a towel after Wudu. Those who disliked it, only disliked it from the view of the saying: "Wudu is weighed." That as reported from Sa'eed bin Al- Musayyab and Az-Zuhri. Muhammad bin Humaid [Ar-Razi] narrated to us, Jarir narrated to us, he said: Ali bin Mujahid narrated to me, and he is trustworthy to me, from me, from: Tha'labah from Az-Zuhri, he said: "The towel is only disliked after Wudu because Wudu is weighed

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّمَنْدُلِ بَعْدَ الْوُضُوءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Using a Towel after Wudu

hadiths.text: Umar bin Al-Khattab narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: 'Whoever performs Wudu, making Wudu well, then says: (Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah, wahdahu la sharika lahu, wa ashhadu anna Muhammadan-abduhu wa rasuluhu, Allahummajalni minat tawwabin, waj'alni minal mutatahhirin) 'I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah Alone, there are no partners for Him. And I testify that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. O Allah! Make me among the repentant, and make me among those who purify themselves.' Then eight gates of Paradise are opened for him, that may enter by whichever of them wishes

chapter.ara-name: باب فِيمَا يُقَالُ بَعْدَ الْوُضُوءِ
chapter.eng-name: [About] What Is Said After Wudu

hadiths.text: Safinah narrated:"The Prophet would perform Wudu with a Mudd, and he would perform Ghusl with a Sa

chapter.ara-name: باب فِي الْوُضُوءِ بِالْمُدِّ
chapter.eng-name: On Wudu With A Mudd

hadiths.text: Ubayy bin Ka'b narrated that :the Prophet said: "Indeed there is a Shaitan for Wudu' who is called "AI-Walahan." So beware of having misgivings about water

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الإِسْرَافِ فِي الْوُضُوءِ بِالْمَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About It Being Disliked To Be Wasteful With Water During Wudu

hadiths.text: Anas narrated that :"The Prophet would perform wudu for every Salat, whether he was in state of purity or not in a state of purity

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ لِكُلِّ صَلاَةٍ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu For Every Salat

hadiths.text: It has been related in a narration from Ibn Umar that :the Prophet said: "Whoever performs Wudu while in a state of purity, Allah writes for him on account of it ten good merits

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ لِكُلِّ صَلاَةٍ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu For Every Salat

hadiths.text: Amr bin Amir Al-Ansari narrated that he heard Anas bin Malik saying:"The Prophet would perform Wudu for every Salat." I said, "So what about you, what would you do?" He said I wouId pray all of the prayers with one Wudu, as long as we had not committed Hadath (anything that invalidates Wudu)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ لِكُلِّ صَلاَةٍ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Performing Wudu For Every Salat

hadiths.text: Sulaiman bin Buraidah narrated that his father said:"The Prophet would perform Wudu for every Salat. So during the year of the Conquest, he performed all of the prayers with one Wudu, and he wiped over his Khuff. So Umar said, 'You did something that you have not done before?' He replied: "I did it on purpose

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّهُ يُصَلِّي الصَّلَوَاتِ بِوُضُوءٍ وَاحِدٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Had Been Related About Performing The (Five Obligatory) Prayers With One Wudu

hadiths.text: Maimunah said:"I and Allah's Messenger would perform Ghusl for Janabah from one vessel

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وُضُوءِ الرَّجُلِ وَالْمَرْأَةِ مِنْ إِنَاءٍ وَاحِدٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man And A Woman Performing Wudu From One Vessel

hadiths.text: Abu Hajib narrated from a man from Banu Ghifar who said:"The Prophet prohibited using the leftover (water) of a woman's Purification

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ فَضْلِ طَهُورِ الْمَرْأَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Use The Leftover Water Of A Woman

hadiths.text: A1-Hakim bin Amr AI-Ghifari narrated that:"The Prophet forbade that a man should perform Wudu with the leftover (water) from a woman's purifcation." Or, he said: "from her drinking

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ فَضْلِ طَهُورِ الْمَرْأَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Use The Leftover Water Of A Woman

hadiths.text: [Ibn Abbas narrated:"One of the wives of the Prophet performed Ghusl with a bowl. Allah's Messenger wanted to perform Wudu with it, so she said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Indeed I am ]unub.' So he said: 'Indeed, water does not become Junub

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرُّخْصَةِ فِي ذَلِكَ
chapter.eng-name: [What has Been Related] About Permitting That

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed AI-Khudri narrated:"It was said, 'O Allah's Messenger! Shall we use the water of Buda'ah well to perform ablution while it is a well in which menstruation rags, flesh of dogs and the putrid are dumped?" Allah's Messenger said: 'Indeed water is pure, nothing makes it impure

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ لاَ يُنَجِّسُهُ شَيْءٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About: Nothing Makes Water Impure

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"I heard AlIah's Messenger while he was being asked about water in open areas of the land, and predators and beasts come to it." He said: 'So Allah's Messenger said: 'When the water is two Qullah it does not carry filth

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ آخَرُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else For That

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Let none of you urinate [in still water, then perform Wudu with it]

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الْبَوْلِ فِي الْمَاءِ الرَّاكِدِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] It Is Disliked Urinate In Stagnant Water

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"A man asked Allah's Messenger 'O Messenger of Allah! We sail the seas, and we only carry a little water with us. If we use it for Wudu then we will go thirsty. So shall we perform Wudu from the (water of the) sea?' Allah's Messenger said: 'Its water is pure, and its dead are lawful

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مَاءِ الْبَحْرِ أَنَّهُ طَهُورٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Sea Water, That It Is Pure

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"The Prophet passed by two graves. He said: 'These two are being punished. And they are not being punished for something major. As for this one, he would not protect himself from his urine. As for this one, he used to spread Namimah (slander)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّشْدِيدِ فِي الْبَوْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Severe Warning Against Not Shielding Oneself From Urine

hadiths.text: Umm Qais bin Mihsan narrated:"I entered upon the Prophet with a son of mine who was not yet eating food. He urinated on him, so he called for water which he sprinkled over it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي نَضْحِ بَوْلِ الْغُلاَمِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَطْعَمَ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Sprinkling Water On The Urine Of Young Boy Before (He reaches The Age That) He Eats Food

hadiths.text: Anas narrated:"Some people from Urainah arrived in Al-Madinah, and they were uncomfortable (and ill from the climate). So Allah's Messenger sent them some camels from charity. He told them: "Drink from their milk and urine." So they killed the camel driver that Allah's Messenger sent, and they violently drove off the camels, and apostatized from Islam. So the Prophet came to them, he cut off their hands and feet on opposite side, and branded their eyes, and threw them in Al-Harrah." Anas said, "So I saw one of them working over the ground with his mouth, until they died

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي بَوْلِ مَا يُؤْكَلُ لَحْمُهُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Urine Of That Whose Meat Is Eaten

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"Allah's Messenger only poked out their eyes because they had poked out the eyes of the camel driver." Abu 'Eisa said: This Hadfth is Gharib. We do not know anyone who mentioned it other than this shaikh, from Yazid bin Zurai. And it is in accordance with the meaning of Allah's saying: "And wounds equal for equal" It has been reported that Muhammad bin Sirin said: "The Prophet only did this to them before the legislated punishments were revealed

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي بَوْلِ مَا يُؤْكَلُ لَحْمُهُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Urine Of That Whose Meat Is Eaten

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "There no Wudu except for a sound or a smell

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِنَ الرِّيحِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wudu For Breaking Wind

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you is in the Masjid, and he senses wind between his buttocks then he should not exit until he hears a sound or smells an odor

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِنَ الرِّيحِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wudu For Breaking Wind

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Indeed Allah does not accept the prayer of one of you when he commits Hadath, until he performs Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِنَ الرِّيحِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wudu For Breaking Wind

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated that :he saw the Prophet sleeping, while in the prostration position, until he snored or snorted. Then he stoodup to pray. So I said: "O Messenger of Allah! You were sleeping?" He said: "Wudu is not required except for sleeping while reclining. For when one reclines, joints relax

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِنَ النَّوْمِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Reported] About Wudu From Sleep

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"The companions of Allah's Messenger would sleep, then stand to pray, They would not perform Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِنَ النَّوْمِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Reported] About Wudu From Sleep

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Wudu is (required) from what fire has touched, even if it be a piece of cheese

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِمَّا غَيَّرَتِ النَّارُ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Wudu From What Has Been Altered By Fire

hadiths.text: Jabir narrated:"Allah's Messenger went out and I went with him. He entered upon a woman from the Ansar. She slaughtered a sheep and he ate from it; and she brought a basket with ripe dates and he ate from it. Then he performed Wudu for Zuhr and prayed. Then he finished, so she brought him something from the remainder of the sheep. So he ate it, then prayed Asr and did not perform Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَرْكِ الْوُضُوءِ مِمَّا غَيَّرَتِ النَّارُ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Not Performing Wudu For What Has Been Altered By Fire

hadiths.text: Al-Bara bin Azib narrated:Allah's Messenger was asked about performing Wudu for camel meat. He said: "Perform Wudu for it." He Was asked about Wudu after eating goat meat. So he said: "Do not perform Wudu for it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِنْ لُحُومِ الإِبِلِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] Wudu From Camel Meat

hadiths.text: Busrah bint Safwan narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever touches his penis, then he is not to pray until he performs Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب الْوُضُوءِ مِنْ مَسِّ الذَّكَرِ
chapter.eng-name: Wudu For Touching The Penis

hadiths.text: Busrah narrated :a similar report (as no. 82) from the Prophet

chapter.ara-name: باب الْوُضُوءِ مِنْ مَسِّ الذَّكَرِ
chapter.eng-name: Wudu For Touching The Penis

hadiths.text: Busrah narrated that :the Prophet said a similar Hadith

chapter.ara-name: باب الْوُضُوءِ مِنْ مَسِّ الذَّكَرِ
chapter.eng-name: Wudu For Touching The Penis

hadiths.text: Qais bin Talq bin Ali - [and he is] Al-Hanafi narrated from his father, that:the Prophet said: 'Is it other than a piece of his flesh?" Or: "part of him?

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَرْكِ الْوُضُوءِ مِنْ مَسِّ الذَّكَرِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] Not Performing Wudu For Touching The Penis

hadiths.text: Urwah narrated from Aishah that:"The Prophet kissed one of his wives, then he went to the prayer and did not perform Wudu." He (Urwah) said: "I said 'Who was it except you?'" [He said:] "So she laughed

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَرْكِ الْوُضُوءِ مِنَ الْقُبْلَةِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] Not Performing Wudu For Kissing

hadiths.text: Madan bin Abi Talhah narrated from Abu Ad-Darda that :"Allah's Messenger vomited [so he broke fast] so he performed Wudu." So I met Thawban in a Masjid in Damascus, and I mentioned that to him. He said: 'He told the truth, I poured the water for his Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِنَ الْقَىْءِ وَالرُّعَافِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] Wudu For Vomit And Nosebleeds

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated:"The Prophet asked me: "What is in your Idawah (water skin)?" I said: "Nabidh." He said: "Dates are wholesome and water is pure." He said: "So he performed Wudu with it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ بِالنَّبِيذِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] Wudu' With Nabidh

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated :the Prophet drank milk. Then he called for water to rinse out his mouth. Then he said: "Indeed it has fat." [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Sahl bin Sa'd As-Sa'idi and Umm Salamah. Abu Eisa said: [And] this Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Some of the people of knowledge held the view that one is to wash the mouth after drinking milk and this is recommended according us. Some others did not hold the view that one is to wash out the mouth after drinking milk

chapter.ara-name: باب فِي الْمَضْمَضَةِ مِنَ اللَّبَنِ
chapter.eng-name: [About] Rinsing Out The Mouth After Drinking Milk

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"A man greeted the Prophet (with Salam), and he was urinating, so he did not respond to him

chapter.ara-name: باب فِي كَرَاهَةِ رَدِّ السَّلاَمِ غَيْرَ مُتَوَضِّئٍ
chapter.eng-name: It Is Disliked To Retum The Salam If One Does Not Have Wudu

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Wash the vessel the dog has drunk from seven times: the first or the last of them with dirt. And when the cat drinks out of it, wash it once

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي سُؤْرِ الْكَلْبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Leftover Water A Dog Has Drank From

hadiths.text: Humaidah bint Ubaid bin Rifa'ah narrated:"Kabshah bint Ka'b bin Malik - she was (married) with Ibn Abi Qatadah - narrated "That Abu Qatadah visited her, [so she said:] 'So I poured water for him to use for Wudu.' She said: 'A cat came to drink, so he lowered he container until it drank.' Kabshah said: 'So he saw me looking at it and said, "O my niece! Are you surprised at that?" So I said yes. He said: "Indeed Allah's Messenger said 'It is not impure, it is only one of those roam around among you

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي سُؤْرِ الْهِرَّةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Leftover Water A Cat Has Drunk From

hadiths.text: Hammam bin AI-Harith narrated:"Jarir bin Abdullah urinated, then he performed Wudu, wiping over his Khuff. So he was asked, 'You do this?' He replied, 'What prevents me, when I have seen Allah's Messenger doing it?" He [Ibrahim] said "And they were impressed by the narration of Jarir since he accepted Islam after the revelation Sural Al-Ma'idah." [This is the saying of lbrahim, that is, "They were impressed."] [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Umar, Ali, Hudhaifah, AI-Mughirah, Bilil, Sa'd, Abu Ayyub, Salman, Buraidah, Amr bin Umayyah, Anas, Sahl bin Sa'd, Ya'la bin Murrah, Ubadah bin As-Samit, Usamah bin Shank, Abu Umamah, Jabir, Usamah bin Zaid, and Ibn Ubadah. They call him Ibn Imarah and Ubayy bin Imarah

chapter.ara-name: باب فِي الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْخُفَّيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: [About] Wiping Over The Two Khuff

hadiths.text: It has been related from Sahr bin Hawshah that he said:"I saw Jarir bin 'Abdullah performing Wudu and he wiped over his Khuff. I asked him about that. He replied, 'I saw 'I saw Allah's Messenger performing Wudu and he wiped over his Khuff.' So I said to him, before Surah AI-Ma'idah (was revealed) or after AI-Ma'idah?' So he replied, 'I did not acceot Islam until after Al-Ma'idah.'" Qutaibah narrated this to us; (saying) Khalid bin Ziyad At-Tirmidhi narrated it to us, from Muqatil bin Hayyan, from Shahr bin Hawshah, from Jarir. He said: Baqiyyah related it from Ibrahim bin Adham from Muqatil bin Hayyan, from Shahr bin Hawshah, from Jarir. This Hadith is explanatory, because some who dislike wiping over the Khuff give the interpretation that the Prophet's wiping over the two Khuff was before the revelation of Sural Al-Ma'idah. But in his Hadlth, Jarir mentions that he saw the Prophet wiping over his Khuff after the revelation of Surat Al-Ma'idah

chapter.ara-name: باب فِي الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْخُفَّيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: [About] Wiping Over The Two Khuff

hadiths.text: Khuzaimah bin Thabit narrated:"The Prophet was asked about wiping over the Khuff. So he said: "Three (days) for the traveler, and one day for the resident

chapter.ara-name: باب الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْخُفَّيْنِ لِلْمُسَافِرِ وَالْمُقِيمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Two Khuff For The Traveler and the Resident

hadiths.text: Safwan bin Assal narrated:'When we were traveling, Allah's Messenger would order us not to remove our Khuff for three days and nights, except for Janabah, but not for defecating, urinating, and sleep

chapter.ara-name: باب الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْخُفَّيْنِ لِلْمُسَافِرِ وَالْمُقِيمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Two Khuff For The Traveler and the Resident

hadiths.text: AI-Mughirah bin Shu'bah narrated:"The Prophet wiped over the Khuff and its bottom

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْخُفَّيْنِ أَعْلاَهُ وَأَسْفَلِهِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Wiping Over he Khuff: The Top Of It And The Bottom Of It

hadiths.text: AI-Mughirah bin Shu'bah narrated:"I saw the Prophet wiping over the Khuff: on the tops of them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْخُفَّيْنِ ظَاهِرِهِمَا
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Wiping Over The Khuff, Their Tops

hadiths.text: Al-Mughirah bin Shu`bah narrated:"The Prophet performed Wudu' and wiped over his socks and sandals

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْجَوْرَبَيْنِ وَالنَّعْلَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Wiping Over Tbe Socks And The Sandals

hadiths.text: Ibn Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah narrated from his father:"The Prophet performed Wudu and wiped over the Khuff and 'Imamah." Abu Bakr (one of the narrators) said: "And indeed I heard it from Ibn Al Mughirah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْعِمَامَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Imamah

hadiths.text: BilaI narrated:"The Prophet wiped over the Khuff and the Khimar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْعِمَامَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Imamah

hadiths.text: Abu Ubaidah bin Muttammad bin Ammar bin Yasir said:"I asked Jabir bin Abdullah about wiping over the Khuff. He said, 'O my nephew! It is the Sunnah.'" [He said:] "And I asked him about wiping over the lmamah. He said, '[Wipe1 the hair [with water]

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الْعِمَامَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wiping Over The Imamah

hadiths.text: Ibn 'Abbas narrated that his maternal aunt Maimunah said:"I prepared some water for the Prophet to perform Ghusl for Janabah with. So he turned the vessel with his left hand, (pouring some water) over his right. Then he washed his hands. Then he entered his hand into the vessel to pour water over his private area, then he rubbed his hands on the wall, or the ground. Then he rinsed out his mouth and washed his nose by putting water in and blowing it out, and washed his face and forearms. Then he poured water over his head three times, then he poured water over the remainder of his body, then he moved from where he was and washed his feet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْغُسْلِ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Ghusl For Janabah

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"When AlIah's Messenger wanted to perform Ghusl for Janabah, he would begin by washing his hands before putting them into the vessel. Then he would wash his private area, and perform the Wudu (as one does) for Salat. Then he would wet his hair with the water, then he would pour water over his head with his hands three times

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْغُسْلِ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Ghusl For Janabah

hadiths.text: Umm Salamah narrated :"I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I am woman with tight braids on my head, should I undo it to perform Ghusl for Janabah? He said: 'No. It is sufficient that you only pour three scoops of water (with hands held together) over your head, then pour water over the rest of your body, to be purified.'" Or he said: "Then you will be purified

chapter.ara-name: باب هَلْ تَنْقُضُ الْمَرْأَةُ شَعْرَهَا عِنْدَ الْغُسْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Should A Woman Undo Her Hair For Ghusl?

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Under every hair is sexual impurity so wash (all of) the hair and cleanse the skin

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ تَحْتَ كُلِّ شَعْرَةٍ جَنَابَةً
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About "Under Each Hair Is Sexual Impurity."

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"The Prophet would not perform Wudu after the Ghusl

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ بَعْدَ الْغُسْلِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Wudu' After Ghusl

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"When the circumcised meets the circumcised, then indeed Ghusl is required. Myself and Allah's Messenger did that, so we performed Ghusl

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ إِذَا الْتَقَى الْخِتَانَانِ وَجَبَ الْغُسْلُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related: When The Two Circumcised Organs Meet, Ghusl Is Required.

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated that :the Prophet said: "When the circumcised meets the circumcised then Ghusl is required

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ إِذَا الْتَقَى الْخِتَانَانِ وَجَبَ الْغُسْلُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related: When The Two Circumcised Organs Meet, Ghusl Is Required.

hadiths.text: Ubayy bin Ka'b narrated:"Water is for water,' was only permitted in the beginning of Islam. Then it was prohibited

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That 'Water Is For Water'

hadiths.text: Ma'mar narrated :a similar narration (as Hadith no. 110) from, Az-Zuhri, with this chain

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That 'Water Is For Water'

hadiths.text: Ibn 'Abbas said:"Water is for water' is only about the wet dream

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That 'Water Is For Water'

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"The Prophet was asked about a man who finds wetness and he does not remember having a wet dream. So he said: 'He is to perform Ghusl. And (he was asked) about a man who had a wet dream but does not find any wetness, so he said: 'No Ghusl is required of him.' Umm Salamah said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Is the woman required to perform Ghusl if she sees that?' He replied: 'Yes. Indeed women are the partners of men

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ يَسْتَيْقِظُ فَيَرَى بَلَلاً وَلاَ يَذْكُرُ احْتِلاَمًا
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About One Who Awakens To Find Wetness, But He Does Not Recall Having A Wet Dream

hadiths.text: Ali narrated:"I asked the Prophet about Al-Madhi. He said: "For Al-Madhi is Wudu, and for AI-Mani is Ghusl

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَنِيِّ وَالْمَذْىِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Al-Mani And Al-Madhi

hadiths.text: Sahl bin Hunaif said:"I suffered from a severe and troubling case of Al-Madhi. I was performing Ghusl often because of it. So I mentioned that to Allah's Messenger and asked him about it. He said: "You only need to perform Wudu for that." I said: "O Messenger of Allah! How about when it gets on my clothes?" He said: "It is sufficient for you to take a handful of water and sprinkle it n your garment wherever you see that it has touched it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَذْىِ يُصِيبُ الثَّوْبَ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Al-Madhi That Touches The Garment

hadiths.text: Hammam bin AI-Harith narrated:"Aishah had a guest to whom she lent a yellow wrap for him to sleep in. He had a wet dream, and was too embarrassed to send it to her while the traces of the wet dream were present on it. So he submerged it (washing it) in water, then he sent it to her. Aishah said, "Why did he ruin our garment? It would have been sufficient for him to scrape it off with his fingers. Sometimes I would scrape it off of the garment of Allah's Messenger with my fingers

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَنِيِّ يُصِيبُ الثَّوْبَ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About AI-Mani That Touches The Garment

hadiths.text: Sulaiman bin Yasar narrated from Aishah, that :she washed Mani from the garment of Allah's Messenger

chapter.ara-name: باب غَسْلِ الْمَنِيِّ مِنَ الثَّوْبِ
chapter.eng-name: Washing AI-Mani From The Garment

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger would sleep while he was Junub, and without touching water (performing Ghusl)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجُنُبِ يَنَامُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَغْتَسِلَ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Person Who Is Junub Sleeping Before performing Ghusl

hadiths.text: Abu Ishaq:There is a similar report (as no. 1I8) narrated via Abu Ishaq

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجُنُبِ يَنَامُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَغْتَسِلَ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Person Who Is Junub Sleeping Before performing Ghusl

hadiths.text: Umar narrated that :he asked the Prophet: "Can one of us sleep while he is Junub?" So he replied: "Yes, when he performs Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ لِلْجُنُبِ إِذَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يَنَامَ
chapter.eng-name: : [What Has Been Related] About Wudu For The Person Who Is Junub When He Wants To Sleep

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet met him while he was Junub. He said: "[So I slipped away from him - meaning:] I withdrew - to perform Ghusl. Then he returned, so he said: 'Where have you been?' Or: 'Where did you go?' I replied: 'I was Junub.' So he said: 'Indeed the believer is not defiled

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مُصَافَحَةِ الْجُنُبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Shaking Hands With The Junub Person

hadiths.text: Umm Salamah narrated:Umm Sulaim bint Milhan came to the Prophet and she said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Indeed Allah is not embarrassed of the truth. So is it required of a woman - meaning Ghusl - when she sees in her sleep similar to what a man sees?' He replied: 'Yes. When she finds water (wetness), then she is perform Ghusl.'" Umm Salamah said: "I said to her: 'O Umm SuIaim! You have disgraced the women

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَرْأَةِ تَرَى فِي الْمَنَامِ مِثْلَ مَا يَرَى الرَّجُلُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Woman Who Sees In A Dream, Similar To What A Man Sees

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Sometimes the Prophet would perform Ghusl from Janabah then come to seek warmth from me, he would hold me and not perform Ghusl

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَسْتَدْفِئُ بِالْمَرْأَةِ بَعْدَ الْغُسْلِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Man Who Seeks The Warmth Of A Woman After Performing Ghusl

hadiths.text: Abu Dharr narrated that :AlIah's Messenger said: "Pure clean earth is a purifier for the Muslim; even if he did not find water for ten years. Then if he finds water, then let him use it (for purification) on his skin. For, that is better

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّيَمُّمِ لِلْجُنُبِ إِذَا لَمْ يَجِدِ الْمَاءَ
chapter.eng-name: [What has Been Related] About Tayammum For The Junub Person When He Does Not Find Water

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Fatimah bint Abi-Hubaish came to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I am a woman who suffers from persistent bleeding and I do not become clean. Shall I give up Salat?' He said: 'No. That is only a bIood vessel, it is not menstruation. When your menstruation begins then leave the Salat. And when it ends, then wash the blood from you and perform Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمُسْتَحَاضَةِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Al-Mustahadah

hadiths.text: Adiyy bin Thabit narrated from his father, that :the Prophet said about the Mustahadah that she should: "Leave the Salat for the days of her period which she menstruates in, then perform Ghusl, and perform Wudu for every Salat, and observe Saum and perform Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةَ تَتَوَضَّأُ لِكُلِّ صَلاَةٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Mustahadah Performing Wudu For Every Prayer

hadiths.text: A similar narration as no. 120. :Abu Eisa said: Sharik is alone in narrating this Hadith from Abu Al Yaqzan.[He said:] I asked Muhammad (ibn Isma'il AI-Bukhari) about this Hadlth. I said: "Adiyy bin Thabit from his father, from his grandfather; what is the name of Adiyy's grandfather?" But Muhammad did not know his name. And I mentioned to Muhammad that Yahya bin Ma'in said his name is Dinar, and he did not contradict him. Ahmad and 1shaq said ahout the Mustahadah: If she performs Ghusl for every prayer that is more prudent for her, and if she performs Wudu for each prayer, then that is acceptable from her, and if she combines between two prayers with (one) Ghusl then that is acceptable

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةَ تَتَوَضَّأُ لِكُلِّ صَلاَةٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Mustahadah Performing Wudu For Every Prayer

hadiths.text: Hamnah bint Jahsh narrated:"I had a case of blood flow that was severe and excessive. So I went to the Prophet to inform him and ask him about it. I found him in the house of my sister Zainab bint Jahsh. I said, 'O Messenger of Allah! I suffer from a case of severe and excessive blood flow. So what do you order me to do for it, and does this prevent me from fasting and performing Salat?' He said: 'Tie a cotton rag around yourself and the bIood will go away.' I said, 'It is more than that.' He said: 'Make it tight.' I said, 'It is more than that.' He said: 'Then use a cloth (to bind it).' I said, it is more than that. It flows too much.' So the Prophet said: 'I will order you to do one of two things, which ever of them you do, it will be acceptable for you. You should know which of them you are able to do.' Then he said: 'This is only a blow from Shaitan. Menstruate for six or seven days, which Allah knows, then perform Ghusl. When you see that you have become pure and clean, then perform Salat for twenty-three or twenty-four nights and their days. Perform Salat and fast, and that will be acceptable for you. So do this (if you can) just as (other) women who menstruate and become pure during their periods of menstruation and purity. If (not, and) you are able to delay Zuhr and hasten Asr then perform Ghusl when you have become pure, and pray Zuhr and Asr together. Then delay Maghrib and hasten Isha, then perform Ghusl and combine the two prayers. So do this (if you are able). Then perform Ghusl with the dawn and pray. Do this, and fast if you are able to do so.' Then Allah's Messenger said: 'That is what is preferable to me of the two

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمُسْتَحَاضَةِ أَنَّهَا تَجْمَعُ بَيْنَ الصَّلاَتَيْنِ بِغُسْلٍ وَاحِدٍ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About AI-Mustahadah That She Can Combine Two Prayers With One Ghusl

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Umm Habibah hint Jahsh sought a verdict from Allah's Messenger. She said 'I suffer from persistent bleeding such that I do not become pere. Shall I give up the Salat?' He said: 'No, that is only a blood vessel. So perform Ghusl then pray.' So she would perform Ghusl for each prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمُسْتَحَاضَةِ أَنَّهَا تَغْتَسِلُ عِنْدَ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Al-Mustahadah That She Is To Perform Ghusl For Every Salat

hadiths.text: Mu'adhah narrated that :a woman asked Aishah: "Shouldn't one of us make up her prayers the days of her menstruation?" So she said, "Are you one of the Haruriyyah? Indeed we would menstruate, and we were not ordered to make up

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْحَائِضِ أَنَّهَا لاَ تَقْضِي الصَّلاَةَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Menstruating Woman: That She Does Not Make Up The Missed Salat

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that :the Prophet said: "The menstruating woman does not recite - nor the Junub - anything from the Qur'an." [He said:] There is narration on this topic from Ali

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجُنُبِ وَالْحَائِضِ أَنَّهُمَا لاَ يَقْرَآنِ الْقُرْآنَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Junub And The Menstruating Persons That They Do Not Recite The Qur'an

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated that:"When I would menstruate, Allah's Messenger ordered me to wear a waist wrap, then he would fondle me

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مُبَاشَرَةِ الْحَائِضِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Fondling Menstruating Woman

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Sa'd narrated:I asked the Prophet about eating with a menstruating woman. He said: "Eat with her

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مُؤَاكَلَةِ الْحَائِضِ وَسُؤْرِهَا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Eating With A Menstruating Woman And Leftovers

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger said to me: 'Bring me the Khumrah from the Masjid.' She said: "I said: 'I am menstruating.' He said: 'Indeed your menstruation is not in your hand

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْحَائِضِ تَتَنَاوَلُ الشَّىْءَ مِنَ الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Menstruating Woman Getting Something From The Masjid

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever engages in sexual intercourse with a menstruating woman, or a woman in her anus, consults a soothsayer, then he has disbelieved in what was revealed to Muhammad

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ إِتْيَانِ الْحَائِضِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Dislike For Engaging In Sexual Intercourse With A Menstruating Woman

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated that :the Prophet said about a man who had sexual intercourse with his wife while she is menstruating: "He should give half a Dinar in charity

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْكَفَّارَةِ فِي ذَلِكَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Atonement For That

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated that :the Prophet said: "When the blood is red then (give) a Dinar. And when the blood is yellow then half Dinar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْكَفَّارَةِ فِي ذَلِكَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Atonement For That

hadiths.text: Asma' bint Abu Bakr narrated that :a woman asked the Prophet about a garment that was touched by some menstrual blood. So Allah's Messenger said: "Remove it, and scrub it, then rinse it and pray in it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي غَسْلِ دَمِ الْحَيْضِ مِنَ الثَّوْبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Washing Menstrual Blood From The Garment

hadiths.text: Umm Salamah narrated:"The time of waiting for Nifas during the time of AIlah's Messenger was forty days. We used to cover our faces with reddish-brown Wars

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَمْ تَمْكُثُ النُّفَسَاءُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About the Extent Of The Waiting During Nifas

hadiths.text: Anas narrated:"Allah's Messenger would go around to his women with one Ghusl

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَطُوفُ عَلَى نِسَائِهِ بِغُسْلٍ وَاحِدٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Going To All Of His Women With One Ghusl

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated that :the Prophet said: When one of you comes to his wife, then he wants to repeat (it), let him perform Wudu between them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجُنُبِ إِذَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يَعُودَ تَوَضَّأَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related [About The Junub Person] When He Wants To Repeat (Sexual Relations) He Should Perform Wudu

hadiths.text: Hisham bin Urwah narrated from his father, (Urwah) from Abdullah bin AI-Arqam. :He (Urwah) said: "While standing for the prayer he (Abdullah bin Al-Arqam) took a man by the hand leading him forward, he (Abdullah) was in front of the people, and he said: 'I heard Allah's Messenger say: "When standing for the prayer and one of you finds that he has to relieve himself then let him relieve himself first

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ إِذَا أُقِيمَتِ الصَّلاَةُ وَوَجَدَ أَحَدُكُمُ الْخَلاَءَ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالْخَلاَءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About When Standing For The Prayer, And One Of You Finds That He Has To Relieve Himself, [Then Let Him Relieve Himself First].

hadiths.text: Abdur-Rahman bin Awf's Umm Walad said, :"I said to Umm Salamah: 'Indeed I am a woman with lengthy hems, and I walk in places of filth.' So she said: 'Allah's Messenger said: "It is purified by what comes after it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوُضُوءِ مِنَ الْمَوْطَإِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Wudu Due To What One Has Walked In

hadiths.text: Ammar bin Yasir narrated that :the Prophet ordered him to perform Tayammum by rubbing his face and two palms

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّيَمُّمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Tayammum

hadiths.text: Ikrimah narrated that :Ibn Abbas was asked ahout Tayammum. He said: "When Allah mentioned Wudu in His Book, He said: "So wash your faces and your hands (forearms) up to the elbows." And He said about Tayammum: "And rub therewith your faces and hands" And He said: "And the male thief and the female thief; cut off their hands." So the Sunnah for cutting is the two hands. So it is only the face and the hands, meaning, Tayammum

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّيَمُّمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Tayammum

hadiths.text: Ali narrated:"Allah's Messenger would recite the Qur'an in all conditions, as long as he was not Junub

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَقْرَأُ الْقُرْآنَ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ جُنُبًا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Reciting The Qur'an Under Any Circumstances As Long As He Is Not Junub

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"A Bedouin entered the Masjid while the Prophet was sitting. He prayed, then when he was finished, he said: 'O Allah! Have mercy upon me and Muhammad, and do not have mercy on anyone along with us.' The Prophet turned, towards him and said: 'You have restricted something that is unrestricted.' It was not long before he was urinating in the Masjid. So the people rushed to him. But Prophet said: 'Pour a bucket of water over it - or - a tumbler of water over it.' Then he said: 'You have been sent to make things easy (for the people); you have not been sent to make things difficult for them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْبَوْلِ يُصِيبُ الأَرْضَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Urine That Touches The Ground

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated similar to this (no. 147).:[He said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud, Ibn Abbas, and Wathilah bin AI-Asqa

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْبَوْلِ يُصِيبُ الأَرْضَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Urine That Touches The Ground

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated that :the Prophet said: "Jibril (peace be upon him) led me (in Salat) twice at the House. So he prayed Zuhr the first time when the shadow was similar to (the length of) the strap a sandal. Then he prayed Asr when everything was similar (to the length of) its shadow. Then he prayed Maghrib when the sun had set and the fasting person breaks fast. Then he prayed Isha when the twilight had vanished. Then he prayed Fajr when Fajr (dawn) began, and when eating is prohibited for the fasting person. The second time he prayed Zuhr when the shadow of everything was similar to (the length of) it, at the time of Asr the day before. Then he prayed Asr when the shadow of everything was about twice as long as it. Then he prayed Maghrib at the same time as he did the first time. Then he prayed Isha, the later one, when a third of the night had gone. Then he prayed Subh when the land glowed. Then Jibril turned towards me and said: "O Muhammad! These are the times of the Prophets before you, and the (best) time is what is between these two times

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مَوَاقِيتِ الصَّلاَةِ عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Prescribed Times for Salat From The Prophet

hadiths.text: Jabir bin Abdullah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Jibril led me (in Salat)". He mentioned something similar to the Hadith of Ibn Abbas (no. 149) in meaning, but he did not mention: "At the time of Asr the day before

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مَوَاقِيتِ الصَّلاَةِ عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Prescribed Times for Salat From The Prophet

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Indeed for (the time of) Salat (there is a) beginning and an end. The beginning of the time for the Zuhr prayer is when the sun passes the zenith, and the end of its time is when the time for Asr enters. The beginning of the time for the Asr [prayer] is when its time enters, and the end of its time is when the sun yellows (turns pale). The beginning of the time of Maghrib is when the sun as set, and the end of its time is when the twilight has vanished (i.e., the horizon is invisible because of darkness). The beginning of the time for Isha, the later one, is when the horizon has vanished, and the end of its time is when the night is at its half. The beginning of the time for Fajr is when Fajr begins, and its end is when the sun rises

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something else (about the timings of Salat)

hadiths.text: Sulaiman bin Buraidah narrated that his father said:"A man came to the Prophet to ask him about the times for Salat. So he said: 'Stay with us, In sha Allah.' So he ordered Bilal to call the Iqamah when Fajr began, then he ordered him to call the Iqamah when the Sun passed the zenith, then he prayed Zuhr. Then he ordered him to call the Iqamah to pray Asr while the sun was elevated and white. Then he ordered him (to call the Iqamah for) Maghrib when the (top) edge of the sun had set. Then he ordered him to call the Iqamah for Isha when the horizon (twilight) had vanished. Then he ordered him in the morning (to give the call for Fajr prayer), when the light of Fajr glowed. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Zuhr, so he waited well until it had cooled. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Asr, so he calIed the Iqamah while the sun was later in its position than what it was (the day before). Then he ordered him to delay Maghrib until right before the twilight had disappeared. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Isha, so he called the Iqamah when a third of the night had passed. Then he said: 'Where is the one who asked about he times for the Salat?' So the man said, 'It is I.' So he said: 'The times [or the Salat are what are between these two]

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something else

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger would pray Subh (at such time that) the women would leave (after the prayer)" - AI-AnsarI (one of the narrators) said - the women would pass by wrapped in their Mirts and they would not be recognizable due to the darkness." And Qutaibah said: "covered." (instead of "wrapped)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّغْلِيسِ بِالْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Praying Fajr In The Dark

hadiths.text: Rafi bin Khadlj said:"I heard Allah's Messenger saying: 'Perform Fajr at AI-Isfar, for indeed its reward is greater

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الإِسْفَارِ بِالْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Al-Isfar In Fajr

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"I have not seen anyone who hastened Zuhr more than Allah's Messenger nor Abu Bakr, nor Umar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّعْجِيلِ بِالظُّهْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Hastening Zuhr

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"Allah's Messenger prayed Zuhr when the sun had passed the zenith

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّعْجِيلِ بِالظُّهْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Hastening Zuhr

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "In very hot weather, delay the (Zuhr) prayer until it becomes (a bit) cooler, because the severity of heat is from the raging of the Hell

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ الظُّهْرِ فِي شِدَّةِ الْحَرِّ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying Zuhr In Severe Heat

hadiths.text: Abu Dharr narrated:"Allah's Messenger was on a journey and Bilal was with him. So he wanted to call for the prayer, but he (the Prophet) said: 'Let it get cooler.' Then he wanted to call for the prayer, so Allah's Messenger said: 'Let it get to the cooler time of Zuhr.'" He (i.e., Abu Dharr) said: "Until we saw the shadows of the hillocks, then he commanded that the Iqamah be called and then led the people in prayer. Allah's Messenger said: 'The severity of heat is from the raging of Hell, so wait until it becomes cooler for the (Zuhr) prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ الظُّهْرِ فِي شِدَّةِ الْحَرِّ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying Zuhr In Severe Heat

hadiths.text: Urwah narrated from Aishah:"Allah's Messenger prayed Asr while the sun was (shining) in her chamber, (and) no shadow appeared in her chamber

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَعْجِيلِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Hastening Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Al-Ala bin Abdur-Raman narrated that :he visited Anas bin Malik in his home in Al Basrah after finishing Zuhr, and his home was next to the Masjid. So he said: 'Stand to pray Asr." He (Al-Ala) said: "So we stood to pray. When we were finished he (Anas) said: 'I heard Allah's Messenger saying: "That is the prayer of the hypocrite. He sits watching the sun, until when it is between the horns of the Shaitan he stands and pecks out four (units of prayer), not remembering Allah in them but a little

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَعْجِيلِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Hastening Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Umm Salamah narrated:"Allah's Messenger would hasten Zuhr more than you (people), while you (people) hasten Asr more than him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Narrator not mentioned:[And I have in my book: "Ali bin Hujr informed me from lsma'il bin Ibrahim, from Ibn Juraij]

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Similar narration is reported by Bishr ibn Mu'adh Al-Bari who said that :Isma'il ibn Ulayyah narrated to him from Ibn Juraij. This latter chain is more correct

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Salmah bin AI-Akwa narrated:"Allah's Messenger prayed Maghrib when the sun had set and it (the sun) had hidden in the veil (of darkness)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَقْتِ الْمَغْرِبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Time For Maghrib

hadiths.text: An-Nu'man bin Bashir said:"I am the most knowledgeable among the people about the prescribed time of this prayer: Allah's Messenger would pray it when the moon set on the third (of the month)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَقْتِ صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Time For The Last Isha Prayer

hadiths.text: An-Nu'man bin Bashir said:A similar narration (from another chain linking to) this chain is also reported

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَقْتِ صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Time For The Last Isha Prayer

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "If it were not that it would be a hardship on my Ummah, then I would have ordered you to delay Isha until the third of the night, or its half

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Last Isha Prayer

hadiths.text: Abu Barzah narrated:"The Prophet would dislike to sleep before Isha and to talk after it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ النَّوْمِ قَبْلَ الْعِشَاءِ وَالسَّمَرِ بَعْدَهَا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Sleep Before Isha And To Talk During The Night After It

hadiths.text: Umar bin Al-Khattab narrated:"Allah's Messenger would talk during the night with Abu Bakr about matters concerning the Muslims while I was with them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مِنَ الرُّخْصَةِ فِي السَّمَرِ بَعْدَ الْعِشَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Permitting Talk After Isha

hadiths.text: Umm Farwah - and she was one of those who gave pledge of allegiance to the Prophet - narrated:"The Prophet was asked: 'Which deed is the best?' So he said: 'Salat in the beginning of its time

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Ali bin AbI Talib narrated that :the Prophet said to him: 'Ali! Three are not to be delayed: Salat when its time comes, a funeral whet it (a prepared body) is present, and the (marriage of a) single woman when there is an equal for her

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The beginning of the time for Salat is pleasing to Allah, and the end of its time is pardoned by Allah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Abu Amr Ash-Shaibani narrated:"A man said to Ibn Mas'ud: 'Which deed is most virtuous?' He said: 'I asked Allah's Messenger (that). He said: "Salat at the beginning of its time." I asked him: "What is after that O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Being dutiful to one's parents." I said: "What is after that [O Messenger of Allah]?" He said: "Jihad in the Way of Allah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger did not pray any Salat at the end of its time two times, until Allah took him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever misses the Asr prayer, then it is as if he was robbed of his family and his property

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي السَّهْوِ عَنْ وَقْتِ، صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Forgetting The rime Of Asr

hadiths.text: Abu Dharr narrated that :the Prophet said: "O Abu Dharr! There will be leaders after me who cause the Salat to die; so perform the Salat during its time. If you pray (with them) during its time, then that will be voluntary Salat for you, if not, then you will have attained your Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَعْجِيلِ الصَّلاَةِ إِذَا أَخَّرَهَا الإِمَامُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Hastening The Salat When The Imam Delays It

hadiths.text: Abu Qatadah narrated:"They asked the Prophet about when they sIept past the Salat. He said: 'There is no negligence in sleep, negligence is only while one is awake. So when one of you forgets a Salat, or sleeps through it, then let him pray it when he remembers it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي النَّوْمِ عَنِ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Sleeping Past The Salat

hadiths.text: Anas (bin Malik) narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever forgets a Salat then he is to pray it when he remembers it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَنْسَى الصَّلاَةَ
chapter.eng-name: Been Related About A Man Who Forgets A Salat

hadiths.text: Abdullah (bin Mas'ud] narrated:"The idolaters kept Allah's Messenger distracted from four prayers on the Day of Al-Khandaq (the battle of the Trench) until as much as Allah willed of the night had passed. So he ordered Bilal to call the Adhan, then he called the Iqamah to Zuhr, then he called the Iqamah to pray Asr, then he called the Iqamah to pray Maghrib, then he called the Iqamah to pray Isha

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ تَفُوتُهُ الصَّلَوَاتُ بِأَيَّتِهِنَّ يَبْدَأُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Misses Multiple Prayers And Which Of Them He Begin With

hadiths.text: Jabir bin Abdullah narrated:"On the Day of Al-Khandaq (the battle of the Trench), Umar bin Al-Khattab came cursing the disbelievers of Quraish and said: 'O Allah's Messenger! I could not offer he Asr prayer until the sun was about to set.' The Prophet said: 'By Allah! I too have not offered the Salat.'" So he said: "We descended into Buthan, Allah's Messenger performed Wudu and we too performed Wudu. Allah's Messenger prayed Asr after the sun had set, then after it he prayed Maghrib

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ تَفُوتُهُ الصَّلَوَاتُ بِأَيَّتِهِنَّ يَبْدَأُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Misses Multiple Prayers And Which Of Them He Begin With

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Salatul-Wusta is the Asr prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي صَلاَةِ الْوُسْطَى أَنَّهَا الْعَصْرُ وَقَدْ قِيلَ إِنَّهَا الظُّهْرُ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About "Salatul-Wusta" [And It Has Been Said That It Is Zuhr]

hadiths.text: Smurah bin Jundub narrated that :the Prophet said: "Salatul-wusta is the Asr prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي صَلاَةِ الْوُسْطَى أَنَّهَا الْعَصْرُ وَقَدْ قِيلَ إِنَّهَا الظُّهْرُ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About "Salatul-Wusta" [And It Has Been Said That It Is Zuhr]

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"I head more than one of the Companions of the Prophet; Umar bin Al-Khattab among, and he was one of the most beloved among them to me - (narrating) that Allah's Messenger prohibited the Salat after Fajr until the sun had risen, and the Salat after Asr until the sun had set

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الصَّلاَةِ بَعْدَ الْعَصْرِ وَبَعْدَ الْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Prayer After Asr And After Fajr Is Disliked

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"The Prophet only performed the two rak'ah (units of prayer) after Asr because some wealth came to him which distracted him from the two rak'ah after Zuhr, so he prayed them after Asr, then he did not repeat that

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ بَعْدَ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Salat After Asr

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mughaffal narrated that :the Prophet said: "Between every two calls (to prayer) there is a Salat for whoever wills

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ قَبْلَ الْمَغْرِبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat Before Maghrib

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever catches a Rak'ah of Subh before the sun has risen, then he has caught Subh. Whoever catches a Rak'ah of Asr before the sun has set, then he has caught Asr

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ أَدْرَكَ رَكْعَةً مِنَ الْعَصْرِ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَغْرُبَ الشَّمْسُ
chapter.eng-name: , What Has Been Related About One Who Caught A Rak'ah About One Asr Before The Sun Has Set

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas said:"Allah's Messenger combined the Zuhr and Asr (prayers), and the Maghrib and Isha (prayers) in Al-Madinah, without being in a state of fear, nor due to rain

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجَمْعِ بَيْنَ الصَّلاَتَيْنِ فِي الْحَضَرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers While [A Resident]

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever combines two prayers without any excuse then he has committed something from the major sins

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجَمْعِ بَيْنَ الصَّلاَتَيْنِ فِي الْحَضَرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers While [A Resident]

hadiths.text: Albdullah bin Zaid narrated:"When we awoke, we went to Allah's Messenger to inform him of the dream. He said: 'Indeed this dream is true. So go to Bilal, for he has a better and louder voice than you. Convey to him what was said to you, so that he may call (to the prayer) with that.'" He said: "When Umar bin Al-Khattab heard Bilal calling for the prayer he went to Allah's Messenger, and he was dragging his Izar, (as he was hurrying) saying: 'O Allah's Messenger! By the One Who sent you with the truth! I dreamt the same as what he said.''' He said: "So Allah's Messenger said: 'To Allah is the praise, so that confirms it even more

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي بَدْءِ الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About How the Adhan Started

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"When the Muslims arrived in AI-Madinah, they used to assemble for the Salat, and guess the time for it there was no one who called for it (the prayer). One day they discussed that and some of them said that they should use a bell like the bell the Christians use. Others said they should use a trumpet like the horn the Jews use. But Umar [bin Al-Khattab] said: 'Wouldn't it better if we had a man call for the prayer?'" He said: "So Allah's Messenger said: 'O Bilal! Stand up and call for the Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي بَدْءِ الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About How the Adhan Started

hadiths.text: Abu Mahdhurah narrated that :Allah's Messenger sat with him and taught him the Adhan word for word. Ibrahim said, "It is the same as our Adhan." Bishr said: "So I said to him, 'Repeat it to me.' So he described the Adhan with At-Tarjl

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّرْجِيعِ فِي الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About At-Tarji In The Adhan

hadiths.text: Abu Mahdhurah narrated that :the Prophet taught him the Adhan with nineteen phrases, and the Iqamah with seventeen phrases

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّرْجِيعِ فِي الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About At-Tarji In The Adhan

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"Bilal was ordered to make the phrases of the Adhan even, and the phrases of the Iqamah odd

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِفْرَادِ الإِقَامَةِ
